page.title: 01Suilven & glencanisp Forest
page.content: This block consists entirely of uncultivated moorland and mountain country forming part of Glencanisp Forest, a deer forest which is part of an even larger privately owned estate. The Main feature of the aea is Caistel Liath (731 metres) the main top of Suilven, one of the most spectacular mounts in the British Isles. The cliffs of this steeply terraced hill are formed of Red Torridonian sandstone lying ona platform of Lewisian Gneiss. At almost 3000 million years old, this is the oldest rock in Britain and it forms the charcteristic landscape of rocky Knolls and Lochans scatterd over the remainder of the area. The main use of the land is as a sporting estate providing deer stalking and fishing etc. The area is also of great interest to hillwalkers,
